message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the location of chloroplasts. Chloroplasts are primarily found in the cells of plant leaves, which are part of the extended portions of a plant. Option (A) stems and option (B) buds may contain chloroplasts, but in smaller amounts compared to the extended portions. Option (D) dry seeds do not contain chloroplasts because they are storage structures for the plant embryo and do not carry out photosynthesis. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) extended portions.

This question requires knowledge about the location of chloroplasts in plants. Chloroplasts are primarily found in the leaves of plants, where they are responsible for photosynthesis. Option (A) is incorrect because chloroplasts are not typically found in high amounts in stems. Option (B) is also incorrect because while buds may contain some chloroplasts, they are not present in great amounts. Option (D) is incorrect because dry seeds do not contain active chloroplasts. Option (C), extended portions, is the correct answer because extended portions refer to the leaves of plants, where chloroplasts are abundant.

This question requires basic knowledge about the location of chloroplasts in plants. Chloroplasts, which are responsible for photosynthesis, are typically found in the cells of photosynthetic tissues. Extended portions, such as leaves and branches, have a larger surface area and are more likely to contain a higher concentration of chloroplasts compared to other parts of the plant. Option (A) is incorrect because stems do not usually contain a significant amount of chloroplasts. Option (B) is also incorrect because buds are usually not photosynthetic structures. Option (D) is incorrect because dry seeds contain stored nutrients for germination but do not have active photosynthetic processes.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the distribution of chloroplasts in plants. Chloroplasts are responsible for photosynthesis and are found in green tissues of plants. Option (C) is the correct answer because extended portions, such as leaves, have a greater surface area for photosynthesis and therefore contain a higher concentration of chloroplasts. Option (A) is incorrect because while chloroplasts can be found in stems, they are typically more abundant in leaves. Option (B) is also incorrect because while buds may contain chloroplasts, they are not likely to have great amounts compared to extended portions. Option (D) is incorrect because dry seeds do not typically contain active chloroplasts, as they are dormant structures waiting for the right conditions to sprout.

This question requires knowledge about the location of chloroplasts in plants. Chloroplasts are the organelles responsible for photosynthesis, and they are typically found in the green parts of plants where photosynthesis occurs. Option (C), extended portions, refers to the extended parts of plants such as leaves, which have a large surface area for absorbing sunlight and conducting photosynthesis. Option (A), stems, typically have less chloroplasts compared to leaves. Option (B), buds, are not an ideal location for finding chloroplasts as they are mainly involved in the development of new growth. Option (D), dry seeds, do not have active chloroplasts because they are in a dormant state.
